history.summary: A 'hunting group' (fighter squadron) of the Luftstreitkräfte, known for being part of Manfred von Richthofen's famed Flying Circus (Jagdgeschwader I). The unit scored 192 confirmed victories during the war.
history.formationContext: Founded on 25 August 1916, drawing personnel from FFA 23, other two-seater reconnaissance units within 2 Armee, Kampfeinsitzerkommando Vaux, and Armee-Flugpark Nr. 2.
history.disbandmentContext: Disbanded at FEA 9, Darmstadt, shortly after the Armistice.

notableEvents.description: Became part of the forming Jagdgeschwader I (JG I), the famed 'Flying Circus'.

details.commandTenure: 1917 (Temporary command of JG I while Richthofen was wounded)

equipment.markingsDescription: Initially included black and white bands around the fuselage. In 1918, Fokker Triplanes were reportedly striped red and turquoise on wings and fuselages.

source.comment: Original source path was an absolute path, changed to a relative one for portability.
